column3: "The Truman Doctrine made clear that the united States could not withdraw from World affairs as it had done after the WWI. Instead
column4: it would actively resist the spread of communism. Sure enough
column5: the announcement of the Truman Doctrine alarmed Stalin." Sinatra Doctrine

column3: "It stipulated that all Eastern European countries would be one-party states
column4: led by the Communist Party and that any attempt in these states to reverse communism would be seen as a threat to all communist states. If such a threat emerged
column5: then other communist states would intervene by sending in troops. All communist states in Eastern Europe were expected to be members of the Warsaw Pact."
